h2.button: Are there variations in wood grain and color?

div.div: Yes. Wood is a natural material, and variations in grain, color, and texture are inherent characteristics. These variations are not considered defects but rather part of the unique beauty of each piece.

h2.button: What is the lead time for custom orders?

div.div: Lead times for custom pieces typically range from 8-12 weeks. This allows our artisans the time to meticulously craft your furniture to our high standards. A more specific timeline will be provided when you place your order.
Absolutely. We encourage you to order material samples to see the colors and textures in your own space. You can order samples directly from the product page or by contacting our team.

h2.button: How can I track my order?

div.div: Once your order has shipped, you will receive an email with tracking information. For larger items requiring freight delivery, our delivery partner will contact you directly to schedule an appointment.

h2.button: What is the difference between Threshold and White Glove delivery?

div.div: Threshold Delivery means your items will be delivered to the first dry area of your home (e.g., inside your front door or garage). White Glove Service is our premium option where our team will deliver to your room of choice, unpack, assemble, and remove all packaging materials. For more details, please see our Shipping + Delivery page.

div.h1: A Process Built on Passion and Precision

div.p: At Atelier Forma, every piece of furniture begins as a conversation between form and function. Our process is a deliberate journey, blending timeless artistry with modern engineering to create pieces that are not only beautiful but are built to become a part of your story.

Every design starts with an idea—a sketch on paper, an architectural detail, or the elegant curve of a natural form. Our designers draw inspiration from the world around them, translating abstract concepts into tangible sketches and initial 3D models. This is where function meets poetry.

We believe that great design is nothing without great materials. We meticulously source our solid woods, genuine leathers, and premium fabrics, ensuring each component meets our exacting standards for quality, sustainability, and durability. The material is not just a part of the design; it *is* the design.

This is where sketches become reality. Our skilled artisans, with decades of combined experience, employ both time-honored techniques and precision technology to craft each piece. From joinery to upholstery, every step is executed with an unwavering attention to detail.

Before a design is approved for our collection, prototypes undergo rigorous testing for comfort, stability, and longevity. We live with our prototypes, refining every angle, curve, and finish until it is not just perfect in appearance, but perfect in experience.
